intro: Scabiosa communis subsp. gramuntia, commonly known as the sweet scabious, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
